description: Returns information about the last resize operation for the specified cluster. If no resize operation has ever been initiated for the specified cluster, a HTTP 404 error is returned. If a resize operation was initiated and completed, the status of the resize remains as SUCCEEDED until the next resize. A resize operation can be requested using  ModifyCluster and specifying a different number or type of nodes for the cluster.

parameters.name: ClusterIdentifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier of a cluster whose resize progress you are requesting. This parameter is case-sensitive. By default, resize operations for all clusters defined for an Amazon Web Services account are returned.

nested_items.name: TargetNodeType
nested_items.description: The node type that the cluster will have after the resize operation is complete.

nested_items.name: TargetNumberOfNodes
nested_items.description: The number of nodes that the cluster will have after the resize operation is complete.

nested_items.name: TargetClusterType
nested_items.description: The cluster type after the resize operation is complete.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of the resize operation.

nested_items.name: ImportTablesCompleted
nested_items.description: The names of tables that have been completely imported .

nested_items.name: ImportTablesInProgress
nested_items.description: The names of tables that are being currently imported.

nested_items.name: ImportTablesNotStarted
nested_items.description: The names of tables that have not been yet imported.

nested_items.name: AvgResizeRateInMegaBytesPerSecond
nested_items.description: The average rate of the resize operation over the last few minutes, measured in megabytes per second. After the resize operation completes, this value shows the average rate of the entire resize operation.

nested_items.name: TotalResizeDataInMegaBytes
nested_items.description: The estimated total amount of data, in megabytes, on the cluster before the resize operation began.

nested_items.name: ProgressInMegaBytes
nested_items.description: While the resize operation is in progress, this value shows the current amount of data, in megabytes, that has been processed so far. When the resize operation is complete, this value shows the total amount of data, in megabytes, on the cluster, which may be more or less than TotalResizeDataInMegaBytes (the estimated total amount of data before resize).

nested_items.name: ElapsedTimeInSeconds
nested_items.description: The amount of seconds that have elapsed since the resize operation began. After the resize operation completes, this value shows the total actual time, in seconds, for the resize operation.

nested_items.name: EstimatedTimeToCompletionInSeconds
nested_items.description: The estimated time remaining, in seconds, until the resize operation is complete. This value is calculated based on the average resize rate and the estimated amount of data remaining to be processed. Once the resize operation is complete, this value will be 0.

nested_items.name: ResizeType
nested_items.description: An enum with possible values of ClassicResize and ElasticResize. These values describe the type of resize operation being performed.

nested_items.name: Message
nested_items.description: An optional string to provide additional details about the resize action.

nested_items.name: TargetEncryptionType
nested_items.description: The type of encryption for the cluster after the resize is complete.

nested_items.name: DataTransferProgressPercent
nested_items.description: The percent of data transferred from source cluster to target cluster.
